DataElement.preferredName: Negation Food and Drug Administration Approval Test Kit Use Screening Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A description of the screening test(s) performed using a test kit that is not Food and Drug Administration approved.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Human Immunodeficiency Virus 1 Nucleic Acid Amplification Test

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Human Immunodeficiency Virus 1 Nucleic Acid Amplification Test
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The type species of lentivirus and the etiologic agent of acquired immunodeficiency syndrome (AIDS). It is characterized by its cytopathic effect and affinity for the T4-lymphocyte.: Any of various amplification and detection strategies applied to detection of virus contamination in donor blood.  Specifically designed to detect recently infected individuals during the latency period before seroconversion.

Concepts.definition: Any viral organism that can be assigned to the species Human Immunodeficiency virus 1.

Any of various amplification and detection strategies applied to detection of virus contamination in donor blood.  Specifically designed to detect recently infected individuals during the latency period before seroconversion.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Human Immunodeficiency Virus 1 And Human Immunodeficiency Virus 2 Antibody

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Human Immunodeficiency Virus 1 And Human Immunodeficiency Virus 2 Antibody
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The type species of lentivirus and the etiologic agent of acquired immunodeficiency syndrome (AIDS). It is characterized by its cytopathic effect and affinity for the T4-lymphocyte.: An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.: An HIV species related to HIV-1 but carrying different antigenic components and with differing nucleic acid composition. It shares serologic reactivity and sequence homology with the simian Lentivirus SIV and infects only T4-lymphocytes expressing the CD4 phenotypic marker.: A protein made by plasma cells (a type of white blood cell) in response to an antigen (a substance that causes the body to make a specific immune response). Each antibody can bind to only one specific antigen. The purpose of this binding is to help destroy the antigen. Some antibodies destroy antigens directly. Others make it easier for white blood cells to destroy the antigen.

Concepts.definition: Any viral organism that can be assigned to the species Human Immunodeficiency virus 1.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.
Any viral organism that can be assigned to the species Human Immunodeficiency virus 2.

A type of protein made by B lymphocytes in response to a foreign substance (antigen). Each antibody only binds to a specific antigen, helping to destroy the antigen directly or by assisting white blood cells to destroy the antigen.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A human deltaretrovirus related to HTLV-2. Human T-lymphotropic virus-1 (HTLV-1) is associated with adult T-cell leukemia (ATL) and HTLV-1-associated myelopathy/tropical spastic paraparesis (HAM/TSP).: Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.: A human deltaretrovirus related to HTLV-1. Although human T-lymphotropic virus-2 (HTVL-2) has been isolated in association with specific diseases it has not been shown to have a causal relationship with any disease.: A protein made by plasma cells (a type of white blood cell) in response to an antigen (a substance that causes the body to make a specific immune response). Each antibody can bind to only one specific antigen. The purpose of this binding is to help destroy the antigen. Some antibodies destroy antigens directly. Others make it easier for white blood cells to destroy the antigen.

Concepts.definition: A human deltaretrovirus related to HTLV-2. Human T-lymphotropic virus-1 (HTLV-1) is associated with adult T-cell leukemia (ATL) and HTLV-1-associated myelopathy/tropical spastic paraparesis (HAM/TSP).
Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.

A human deltaretrovirus related to HTLV-1. Although human T-lymphotropic virus-2 (HTVL-2) has been isolated in association with specific diseases it has not been shown to have a causal relationship with any disease.

A type of protein made by B lymphocytes in response to a foreign substance (antigen). Each antibody only binds to a specific antigen, helping to destroy the antigen directly or by assisting white blood cells to destroy the antigen.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A parasitic infection caused by Trypanosoma cruzi. It is transmitted by insect bites. It is characterized by an acute and chronic phase; in the acute phase patients may have fever, malaise, and swelling at the site of the insect bite. In the chronic phase patients develop hepatosplenomegaly, lymphadenopathy, cardiomyopathy and arrhythmias.

Concepts.definition: A parasitic infection caused by Trypanosoma cruzi. It is transmitted by insect bites. It is characterized by an acute and chronic phase; in the acute phase patients may have fever, malaise, and swelling at the site of the insect bite. In the chronic phase patients develop hepatosplenomegaly, lymphadenopathy, cardiomyopathy and arrhythmias.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: West Nile Virus Nucleic Acid Amplification Test

ValueMeaning.preferredName: West Nile Virus Nucleic Acid Amplification Test
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A species of flavivirus, one of the Japanese encephalitis virus group. It can infect birds and mammals and is spread especially from birds to humans by mosquitoes. Human infection causes an illness marked by fever, headache, muscle ache, skin rash, and sometimes encephalitis or meningitis.: Any of various amplification and detection strategies applied to detection of virus contamination in donor blood.  Specifically designed to detect recently infected individuals during the latency period before seroconversion.

Concepts.definition: A species of flavivirus, one of the Japanese encephalitis virus group. It can infect birds and mammals and is spread especially from birds to humans by mosquitoes. Human infection causes an illness marked by fever, headache, muscle ache, skin rash, and sometimes encephalitis or meningitis.

Any of various amplification and detection strategies applied to detection of virus contamination in donor blood.  Specifically designed to detect recently infected individuals during the latency period before seroconversion.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.: Any immunoglobulin that recognizes the cytomegalovirus virus.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.
Any immunoglobulin that recognizes the cytomegalovirus virus.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A contagious venereal disease caused by the spirochete TREPONEMA PALLIDUM.

Concepts.definition: A contagious bacterial infection caused by the spirochete Treponema pallidum. It is a sexually transmitted disorder, although it can also be transmitted from the mother to the fetus in utero. Typically, it is initially manifested with a single sore which heals without treatment. If the infection is left untreated, the initial stage is followed by skin rash and mucous membrane lesions. A late stage follows, which is characterized by damage of the internal organs, including the nervous system.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Hepatitis C Virus Nucleic Acid Amplification Test

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Hepatitis C Virus Nucleic Acid Amplification Test
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A small, enveloped, positive sense single strand RNA virus in the family Flaviviridae. The genome consists of a single RNA molecule with a single open reading frame.: Any of various amplification and detection strategies applied to detection of virus contamination in donor blood.  Specifically designed to detect recently infected individuals during the latency period before seroconversion.

Concepts.definition: A small, enveloped, positive sense single strand RNA virus in the family Flaviviridae. The genome consists of a single RNA molecule with a single open reading frame.

Any of various amplification and detection strategies applied to detection of virus contamination in donor blood.  Specifically designed to detect recently infected individuals during the latency period before seroconversion.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An antibody produced by B-lymphocytes in response to hepatitis C virus infection

Concepts.definition: An antibody produced by B-lymphocytes in response to hepatitis C virus infection.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Hepatitis B Virus Nucleic Acid Amplification Test

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Hepatitis B Virus Nucleic Acid Amplification Test
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Hepatitis B Virus (HBV) is the prototype of the Hepadnavirus Family.  Included in the family are the Woodchuck Hepatitis Virus (WHV) and the Duck Hepatitis B Virus (DHBV) which provide animal models of infection.  The HBV genome is a partially double stranded circular DNA.  A viral reverse transcriptase is bound to the 5' extremity of the long strand.: Any of various amplification and detection strategies applied to detection of virus contamination in donor blood.  Specifically designed to detect recently infected individuals during the latency period before seroconversion.

Concepts.definition: Hepatitis B Virus (HBV) is the prototype of the Hepadnavirus Family.  Included in the family are the Woodchuck Hepatitis Virus (WHV) and the Duck Hepatitis B Virus (DHBV) which provide animal models of infection.  The HBV genome is a partially double stranded circular DNA.  A viral reverse transcriptase is bound to the 5' extremity of the long strand.

Any of various amplification and detection strategies applied to detection of virus contamination in donor blood.  Specifically designed to detect recently infected individuals during the latency period before seroconversion.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An antibody produced by B lymphocytes to the hepatitis B core antigen as part of the immune response to hepatitis B viral infection.

Concepts.definition: An antibody produced by B lymphocytes to the hepatitis B core antigen as part of the immune response to hepatitis B viral infection.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any one of the hepatitis B antigens found on the surface of the Dane particle and on the 20 nm spherical and tubular particles. Several subspecificities of the surface antigen are known. These were formerly called the Australia antigen.

Concepts.longName: Hepatitis B Virus HBsAg Surface Protein Antigen
Concepts.definition: Any one of the hepatitis B antigens found on the surface of the Dane particle and on the 20 nm spherical and tubular particles. Several subspecificities of the surface antigen are known. These were formerly called the Australia antigen.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: A practiced and regimented skill or series of actions.

Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
